channel.title: Latest Finextra Research Security Headlines
channel.description: The Latest Financial IT Security Headlines

item.title: Cybercrime marketplace shut down
item.description: One of the world's biggest online marketplaces selling stolen credentials has been shut down following an operation involving a host of law enforcement agencies.

item.title: Oscilar emerges from stealth to secure online transactions
item.description: Confluent co-founder Neha Narkhede and former Meta engineering executive Sachin Kulkarni have unveiled a new venture that uses real-time data and AI to protect online transactions.

item.title: BIS Innovation Hub opens in Paris and Frankfurt
item.description: The Bank for International Settlements has opened its European Hub, located in both Paris and Frankfurt, with a focus on decentralised finance, wholesale CBDC, cyber security and green finance.

item.title: CBA and Telstra test APP fraud detector
item.description: Commonwealth Bank of Australia is working on a scam busting joint venture with local telco Telstra that could save customers up to $20 million in annual authorised push payment fraud.

item.title: Latitude Financial reveals 14 million customer records stolen in cyber attack
item.description: Australian consumer lender Latitude Finanial has revealed that 14 million customer records, including drivers licences, passports and financial statements were stolen in a cyber attack.

item.title: TikTok faces intense scrutiny from US Congress
item.description: US Congress grilled TikTok CEO, Shou Zi Chew, when he appeared before Congress yesterday, as the company faces increasing calls for a US ban.

item.title: Mastercard acquires Swedish cyber-security firm Baffin Bay
item.description: Mastercard has acquired Swedish cybersecurity firm Baffin Bay as part of plans to build a multi-layered protective shield for customers across the world

item.title: Trust:Live 2023: Evolving digital identity, intelligence and innovation
item.description: This week, LexisNexis® Risk Solutions and Finextra Research held Trust:Live 2023, the exclusive in-person event for all fraud and identity decision makers focusing on the latest challenges in establishing trust to protect customers, defend brands, or meet the needs of evolving business models.

item.title: Fed governor Waller caught up in porn Zoom-bombing
item.description: Federal Reserve governor Christopher Waller was forced to abandon his remarks at a Zoom conference after a user hijacked the call and displayed pornography.

item.title: Senators urge regulators to take action on Zelle fraud
item.description: Senate Democrats, including Elizabeth Warren, have called on financial regulators to take action to tackle fraud related to the bank-owned Zelle P2P payments service.

item.title: Westpac adds anti-scam feature
item.description: Australian bank Westpac is adding a security layer for online payments as it seeks to address record customer losses to scams.

item.title: Offline CBDC could boost financial inclusion and privacy - Bank of Canada
item.description: An offline CBDC could offer a compliment to cash that would boost financial inclusion and preserve privacy, suggests a note from the Bank of Canada.

item.title: BNP Paribas selects Worldline to reduce Iban fraud in Sepa Direct Debits
item.description: BNP Paribas Cash Management has selected Worldline (Euronext: WLN), a global leader in payments services, to reduce fraud in SEPA Direct Debit transactions.

item.title: Drawbridge names Chris Aronis chief revenue officer
item.description: Drawbridge, a premier provider of cybersecurity software and solutions to the alternative investment industry, today announced it has appointed Chris Aronis as its Chief Revenue Officer (CRO).

item.title: NAB introduces payment prompts to protect customers from fraud
item.description: NAB has today started introducing more proactive prompts to digital banking to help customers identify potential scams and to make sure money is going to the right recipient when they’re making a payment.

item.title: Binance joins Fido Alliance
item.description: We are excited to announce that Binance has officially joined the FIDO Alliance, one of the most influential and largest associations focused on developing passwordless authentication standards.

item.title: Kroll invests in fraud detection platform EverC
item.description: EverC, a pioneer in AI-driven merchant and marketplace risk intelligence and insights for ecommerce and payment providers, recently announced a new investment by the & Opportunity Fund and strategic partnership with Kroll, the leading independent provider of risk and financial advisory solutions.

item.title: EMVCo, Fido Alliance and W3C extend web payments collaboration
item.description: EMVCo, the FIDO Alliance and the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) have renewed the charter for the Web Payments Security Interest Group (WPSIG) for a further two years.

item.title: G+D unveils biometric tech
item.description: Although banks have mastered the use of passwords, customers increasingly look for more seamless but still secure ways to access their digital services.

item.title: Askari Bank taps BPC for credit card and online fraud management system
item.description: Global payments fintech BPC today announced a technical partnership with Askari Bank in Pakistan.

item.title: Pidgin boost fraud detection with Effectiv tie-up
item.description: Pidgin, a secure, real-time payments platform built for the future of payments, has partnered with Effectiv, a fraud-fighting and compliance automation platform to help financial institutions monitor transactions to detect and prevent payments fraud in real time.

item.title: Emirates NBD teams with Plug and Play in search for fintechs with risk expertise
item.description: Emirates NBD, a leading banking group in the MENAT (Middle East, North Africa and Turkey) region, continues its strategic partnership with Plug and Play Abu Dhabi, the world’s largest innovation enabler, this time seeking FinTech’s to support the bank in its risk management domain.

item.title: EBA Clearing to enrich RT1 and STEP2 with fraud prevention and detection capabilities
item.description: EBA CLEARING announced today that it will enrich its SEPA payment systems, RT1 and STEP2, with fraud prevention and detection capabilities by November 2023.

item.title: Zeta partners Featurespace to deliver fraud detection to credit card issuers
item.description: Zeta, a next-gen credit card processor, and Featurespace, a world leader in enterprise fraud and financial crime prevention, today announced their partnership to bring to market a solution that combines best-in-class credit card processing and fraud detection for Issuers in the US.

item.title: Why is 3DS adoption important for merchants?
item.description: Speaking at Merchant Payments Ecosystem 2023, Ivan Vukelikj, Senior Product Manager Secure Digital Payments, Netcetera, discusses how the adoption of 3DS will contribute to the improvement of digital payment services.

item.title: The emergence of risk orchestration technology
item.description: Speaking at Trust:Live 2023, LexisNexis® Risk Solutions Market Planning Director, Chris Foye, discusses how risk orchestration technology is transforming the way in which organisations evaluate and build digital trust with their customers.

item.title: The advantages of behavioural biometrics
item.description: Speaking at Trust:Live 2023, Chief Architect of LexisNexis® BehavioSec™, Neil Costigan and LexisNexis® Risk Solutions Director of Market Planning, Fraud & Identity, Rob Woods, discuss why behavioural biometrics are important in building digital trust with online users and how this technology is evolving to meet emerging online threats.

item.title: Why does digital trust matter for businesses?
item.description: Connecting with LexisNexis® Risk Solutions at Trust:Live 2023: Matthias Baumhof, CTO of LexisNexis® ThreatMetrix®, LexisNexis® Risk Solutions, analyses how technology can be taught to establish online trust and its future in online businesses.

item.title: Rethinking digital identity in a post pandemic world
item.description: Speaking at LexisNexis® Risk Solutions Trust:Live 2023, Niall McCann, Policy Consultant, Legal Identity, UN Development Programme, discusses the legal rights to identity in the digital space and what difficulties governments are facing when managing digital ID.

item.title: What more can Governments do to fight financial crime?
item.description: Speaking at LexisNexis® Risk Solutions Trust:Live 2023, Professor Mark Button, Co-Director, Centre for Cybercrime and Economic Crime, University of Portsmouth, examines how far behind industry is in the fight against fraud and what potential strategies there are to turn this tide.

item.title: How identity verification is the foundation for fintech's future
item.description: Michael Ramsbacker, Chief Product Officer, Trulioo joins FinextraTV at Money20/20 in Las Vegas, discussing how identity verification is fast becoming the foundation of the future of digital banking. Ramsbacker divulges how organizations should think about identity verification considering increasingly stricter regulations, how crypto exchanges can manage shifting compliance and regulatory requirements, and what is possible when companies can optimize their digital identity verification processes.

item.title: Tokenization in financial services
item.description: Valeria Zafar, Director, Capital Markets Sales, EMEA, Digital Asset and Georg Schneider, Director of Financial Engineering, Digital Asset join FinextraTV at Sibos 2022, assessing the current climate in tokenization and why we are seeing a similar rise in other FIs, including what is required technically from legacy systems and what is needed for market participants to realize the full benefits of tokenization.

item.title: Jason Lane-Sellers, from LexisNexis Risk Solutions, discusses scams and the cross-industry aspects
item.description: FinextraTV is joined at Sibos 2022 by Jason Lane-Sellers, Director of Fraud and Identity Expert EMEA for LexisNexis® Risk Solutions. Delving into the topic of targeted social engineering, Lane-Sellers gives insight into current scams, their methodology, and practical guidance in managing the risks and impacts of fraudulent behaviour.

item.title: SCA remains top requirement for merchants
item.description: David Jeffrey, Director, Head of Product - Fraud & Security, Barclaycard Payments, speaks at MPE 2022 about why Strong Customer Authentication (SCA) holds its place at the top of merchant's agendas and why it is such an important requirement still. We evaluate the lessons learned from the implementation of SCA so far, the impact this has had on customer experience and what merchants can do to rectify this.

item.title: Money 20/20: Why embedded finance is the key to driving financial inclusion
item.description: Mikkel Velin, Founder & CEO of YouLend, speaks at Money 20/20 about the main differences between data points used by traditional finance applications and newer, progressive data points, where these new data points come from and how embedded finance enable these new risk modelling techniques, how this is driving financial inclusion for SMEs in 2022, and how the platforms SMEs use, such as e-commerce platforms or payment service providers are benefitting too.

item.title: EBAday 2022: Supporting harmonisation of KYC requirements
item.description: The Euro Banking Association is contributing to standardised and digitalisable KYC processes for corporate customers and banks. EBA Secretary General Thomas Egner reports on a first important deliverable towards a more uniform customer experience across Europe.

item.title: Money 20/20: A New Perspective on Securing High Value Digital Interactions
item.description: Matthew Moynahan, CEO at OneSpan, speaks at Money 20/20 on current digitization trends in financial services and the reasons why security needs to be woven seamlessly through the customer journey. Hear Matt discuss the top requirements for conducting business in today’s hyperconnected digital world, including the ability to verify the identity of a customer, authenticate users, and ensure that hybrid and virtual engagement models are secure and compliant.

item.title: Real-time payments: How banks and FIs can win competitive advantage
item.description: Watch this webinar on how financial institutions are leveraging real-time payments to stand out against emerging competitors.

item.title: APP and money mules: what role do banks play?
item.description: Watch this webinar, in association with NICE Actimize, on why financial institutions must prioritise risk management strategies as the volume of APP scams rises worldwide.

item.title: Ethical AI in fraud scoring: Mitigating bias and model degradation in machine learning
item.description: Register for our upcoming webinar with ACI Worldwide on Thursday 27th April 2023 at 3PM BST, as industry experts discuss how ethical AI can be used to improve fraud scoring.

item.title: Tapping into friendly friction to prevent fraud
item.description: While headway has been made in the fight to protect consumers against APP (Authorised Push Payment) fraud, the UK’s Payment Systems Regulator is pursuing plans to make reimbursement mandatory for victims of such scams.

item.title: Embedded Finance: A marketplace differentiator for banks
item.description: Embedded finance is not a new concept. Corporations outside of the financial services industry have provided banking services through credit cards at shops, supermarkets, and airlines; financing at retailers; and loans at car dealerships for decades.

item.title: Sponsor's message: [New Impact Study] Secure Virtual Signing Experience: Customer Requirements
item.description: [New Impact Study] Secure Virtual Signing Experience: Customer Requirements
